DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Joints and Fascia Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the chronic graft versus host disease response for joints and fascia based on clinician assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Joint And Fascia Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredName: Clinician Assessment Joint And Fascia Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: cGvHD Joint and Fascia Response Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NIH Joint and Fascia Score 0 and P-ROM score 25 after previous involvement by at least 1 measure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NIH Joint and Fascia Score 0 and P-ROM score 25 after previous involvement by at least 1 measure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Both an NIH joint and fascia score of 0 and a P-ROM score of 25 after previous GvHD involvement by at least 1 measure.

Concepts.longName: Joints and Fascia Complete Response GvHD
Concepts.definition: Both an NIH joint and fascia score of 0 and a P-ROM score of 25 after previous GvHD involvement by at least 1 measure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Decrease in NIH Joint and Fascia Score by 1 or more points or increase in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Decrease in NIH Joint and Fascia Score by 1 or more points or increase in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A NIH Joint and Fascia score that has decreased by 1 or more points or an increase in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site.

Concepts.longName: Joints and Fascia Partial Response GvHD
Concepts.definition: A NIH Joint and Fascia score that has decreased by 1 or more points or an increase in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase in NIH Joint and Fascia Score by 1 or more points or decrease in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase in NIH Joint and Fascia Score by 1 or more points or decrease in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A NIH joint and fascia score that has increased by 1 or more points or a decrease in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site.

Concepts.definition: A NIH joint and fascia score that has increased by 1 or more points or a decrease in P-ROM score by 1 point for any site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
